original_body_lines: The very first time music lovers here had the opportunity of experiencing the singing capabilities of Kay Jay was when she teamed up with her father, the late Ivan Jayaratne, and operated as a duo.

The father and daughter combination turned out to be quite popular, and, before long, Kay Jay found herself doing vocals for some of the leading bands, in the local scene, during that era, including Dream Team, 20th Century and Cardinal Outburst.
Later, Kay Jay operated as a solo artiste before deciding to seek new pastures abroad.
Kay Jay had to curtail her musical career, when she got to Germany, as she got involved in the beauty industry…having her own beauty salon in Germany and now in Switzerland, as well.
In addition to her beauty salons, Kay Jay has also come up with her own beauty products – Kay Jay cosmetics.

With her beauty products and salons now firmly established, Kay Jay has decided to make a comeback to the music scene – operating as a duo with Adam Amaradasa, and also doing the duo scene with Sanjaya Alles and Derek Rutnam.
On the 5th of October, she was seen in action at a gig in Liechtenstein, along with Sanjaya Alles, Derek Rutnam, and Adam Amaradasa,
Says Kay Jay: “Although I do the duo scene with Sanjaya, Derek and Adam, this is the first gig I’m doing with all three together.
“The trio are not only talented musicians…they are humble, and very kind and a pleasure to work with.
“Believe me, I never ever thought that one day I would be performing with these three very talented musicians.”
Kay Jay also mentioned that she now performs mainly with Adam Amaradasa, adding that he is an amazing skillful singer and a good musician.
“I’m enjoying my life entertaining people as I did so many years ago. Now I’m back on stage, after about 25 years or so.
“To be back on stage gives me the opportunity to make others happy in another way as I love to see people enjoying their lives.

“When I’m on stage, it’s another world for me, especially when I see a crowd having a great time. It makes you feel so good. I would say it’s the love and passion you generate that radiates to the crowd to enjoy the music that emanates from the stage.
“When you sing to them from your heart they are so touched that sometimes you see them even crying.
“I’m truly enjoying being back on stage and keeping the crowd entertained.”
